it's a fun horror game with a lot of sick licenses, giving it a smash bros-esque roster. I'd recommend this if you're a fan of slasher films like Halloween, Texas Chainsaw Massacre, The Ring, Saw, and other stuff like that. It's a nice love letter to horror movie fanatics. Even then so, the vanilla/non licensed killers themselves are designed pretty well as horror characters.

jeu plein d'adrénaline. Dans un enclos enfermé, sois tu essaies de travailler en équipe pour réussir à ouvrir l'Enclos et t'échapper avec les 3 autres qui tentent de survivre, ou soit tu joues le tueur et tu essaies de tous les attraper et de les pendre avant qu'ils ne s'échappent. C'est rapîde, brutal et super amusant . Les persos sont sympa à jouer avec des compétences variées (mais se ressemblent trop à mon goût). Je déplore le fait que les serveurs fassent des groupes de joueurs disparates, ainsi tu peux être débutant et te retrouver contre un joueur beaucoup trop fort ou vice et versa, ça gâche un peu la partie. Les maps se ressemblent trop aussi. Un peu de variétés feraient du bien. Idéalement jouer avec une manette et avoir un minimum de réflexes sinon je ne donne pas cher de votre peau. C'est complètement nul les parties où les tueurs sont milles fois plus fort que les survivants où le contraire... équilibrez les forces, franchement!!!

Most notably, it's a good 'forever game' in that, when there's nothing else to take your immediate attention, DBD is a fun, comfortable and exciting game to come back to. But on its own it really does hold up. The first few hours of play are pretty "horror" exciting, but very quickly the game progresses into an "Action 1 v 4 multiplayer experience" with cool strategy and a lot of opportunities for funny interactions between the teams.

The game is updated frequently, mostly to add new content, but the devs are pretty good about fixing onerous issues with balance or bugs etc. I will say though, they're definitely one of those studios stuck in the "must prioritize new content over fixing existing stuff" Capitalist profit-driven rut, so the longer you play, the more you'll discover long-time frustrations w/ balance or w/e that you just know probably won't get fixed.
But truly and honestly it's never anything *game breaking*

16年入坑，最开始感觉游戏非常恐怖，一个人完全不敢玩，后来逐渐胆大，疫情开始每年疫情期间都和朋友一起联机玩，到现在一个人无聊就玩，并且看着B站各种人皇屠皇睡觉，然而现在游戏视频无法上传，制作组官方号被封，让我觉得更应该支持一下，游戏虽然没有国服，但是对国人的友好态度一直都在，虽然有些平衡性问题，但玩游戏本质上为了快乐而不是为了输赢，希望大家不要有那么重的戾气，也对制作组多一些包容，[b] 当然最希望制作组给开一个国服 [/b]，[spoiler] 延迟刀吃多了人难受，回血板砍多了鬼难受 [/spoiler]，[u] 最后预祝玩这个游戏的各位专家们稳住血压 [/u]。

Though the game leans a lot in the killer's favor, it's one versus four, and as you quickly blaze through bloodwebs and experience points in game and through the Rift progressions, gaining your personal best set of abilities and tools to use throughout every match helps greatly. Though games can be frustrating (as all PvPs are), playing with friends helps immensely, and this has quickly become one of my favorite games because of the quick, intense matches and beautiful work on the game (as well as fun DLCs, new content frequently, and amazing backstories and shorts)!
simple scary fun, but obviously you can get better at running from killer/ killing survivors so it is fairly challenging for a super simple game.

Отзывы никто не читает, поэтому напишу рецепт овощного салата с тунцом
Продукты (на 2 порции)
Тунец, консервированный в собственном соку - 1 банка
Помидоры черри - 5-6 шт.
Яйцо куриное - 2 шт.
Лук белый - 1 шт.
Огурец большой - 1 шт.
Масло оливковое - 2 ст. ложки
Салат листовой - 100 г
Петрушка - пару веточек
Соль - по вкусу
Перец черный молотый - по вкусу

Для приготовления овощного салата с тунцом подготовьте все необходимые продукты. Овощи помойте, обсушите, слейте воду с тунца. Яйца отварите 8 минут, сразу остудите в холодной воде.

Чистые салатные листья выложите в удобную посуду, заправьте оливковым маслом, солью и перцем, перемешайте.

Выложите салатные листья на блюдо для подачи.

В центр выложите кусочки консервированного тунца в собственном соку.

Нарежьте помидоры черри, выложите их на салат.

Следующим нарежьте огурец, добавьте в салат.


Аккуратно разрежьте яйцо на четыре части, выложите на салат, сбрызните его немного оливковым маслом, посолите и поперчите. Украсьте листиками петрушки.

Посыпьте верх салата кружочками сладкого белого лука.

Подавайте вкуснейший, легкий и полезный овощной салат с тунцом сразу же после приготовления.

¿No te gusta que te humillen, que se burlen de ti, que te reclamen de todo y te insulten sin importar que hagas y a quién escojas? No juegues.
¿Tienes mucho tiempo disponible para invertir en el juego aprendiendo sobre sus mecánicas, estudiando, entrenando y haciendo un exhaustivo grinding para desbloquear cosas? Juegalo.
¿Te justa jugar de forma casual y no te importa ganar? Juegalo.
¿Estás de acuerdo en que vas a jugar un juego roto y que los desarrolladores tienen más interés en sacar skins que arreglar el juego? Juegalo.

I have mixed feelings towards this game, because while I love playing the game and learning how to master each killer, I know how it feels to be dragged through the dirt and gated out of enjoyment by the toxic side of the community for a long, long time as you try to learn. A lot of people like to say that the whole community consists of the most rude people to ever exist and that the devs don't give a single care in the world about the game, but I know neither of those things are true statements, or even sensible ones. The sad reality of this game is that much of the playerbase just does not know how to loosen up and play for fun, because the game is a LOT more competitive than it would seem on the surface. Just as it would be in a real life scenario, the situations get cutthroat and are played dirty by both killers AND survivors. Sometimes it results in insults being thrown after a match, sometimes it results in being flat out bullied by the opposing side in-game, just because of the contextual disposition. Don't get me wrong, I've had countless interactions with many nice and fun people, but I would be lying if I said I didn't have my fair share of the times that I couldn't even consider fun. TLDR: I enjoy the game a LOT, but its often competitive nature can make it inaccessible to newcomers.
